thread.title: Arthur Blank is running out of dance moves celebrating the Falcons’ lead
thread.title_full: Arthur Blank is running out of dance moves celebrating the Falcons’ lead

author: Jeanna Thomas
title: Arthur Blank is running out of dance moves celebrating the Falcons’ lead
text: Rec The Falcons took a 25-point lead over the New England Patriots in the third quarter of Super Bowl LI, and Atlanta’s owner, Arthur Blank, was pretty excited about it. That double fist pump from Blank is representative of what anyone who is rooting for the Falcons must be feeling right now — unadulterated joy. It’s not, however, his first, or his finest dance move this postseason. Blank’s dancing has become synonymous with his team’s success. He danced the night away after the Falcons defeated the Green Bay Packers in the NFC Championship to earn the second Super Bowl bid in team history. Keep on dancing, Arthur! pic.twitter.com/TpqRuB56Kj — Atlanta Falcons (@AtlantaFalcons) January 22, 2017 The dancing began after the Falcons took care of business against the Seattle Seahawks in the divisional round. Keep on dancing, Mr. Blank. In this Storystream
